Articles.Content: Hi. I use KSP 1.2.2 and  have about 50-60 mods installed. The game crashes just before the title screen. Is there any way that I can find out what mod is causing the crash trough the output or something.
Maybe you should just use less mods? I know right, when you have like 50 mods and you delete one, most of your craft is gone.Despite that, you will have your game running, and that is very important.

Or make a fresh install of KSP, install one half of mods and Test. If it crashes you know the "badboy" is there and the Way After is, half out Test again.

If crashes half again if not try the other half.

At this way you have After like 7 Starts your conflict Maker. Or you know that there is a modconflikt there, 2 Mods fight each other. 

And this is a boring, you have to Track down  all Treads to find if Somebody mentioned a incompability.

And are all Mods compatible with 1.2.2 and you have all in the latest Versions?

Edited March 23, 2017 by Urses
Make sure you are running 64bit and have enough memory.  You may also have to force dx11 or opengl to reduce memory load.

if you're running the x86 version of the game it only supports 4 gb of RAM, so the game will crash on the loading screen if you have too many.  if your computer can support it, run the x64 executable instead.
Thaks Guys, Fixed it.
